summary: The 'Fighting Fibers Act of 2025' mandates that all new washing machines sold in the US, starting January 1, 2030, must have a microfiber filtration system.  The EPA Administrator, in conjunction with the Secretary of Energy, will determine the specific filtration standards. The bill also requires labeling and sets civil penalties for violations. Furthermore, it mandates a nationwide study on the presence, sources, impacts (including environmental justice), and pathways of microfibers in the human body and the environment, with a report to Congress within one year of enactment.
